image.altText: A white truck, pursued by multiple police vehicles, drives on the wrong side of the road at night time.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man has been refused bail after engaging Tasmania Police in an hours-long pursuit during which he drove a stolen truck through Launceston on blown-out tyres.

title.children: Police chase 'a bit Fred Flintstone, a bit Blues Brothers', witness says

image.altText: A very skinny horse standing in a paddock

props.synopsis: The RSPCA's prosecution panel has "extensively reviewed the facts" and decided not to lay charges after three thoroughbred horses once owned by a former Tasmanian attorney-general, were found emaciated.

title.children: No charges laid over emaciation of horses once owned by Vanessa Goodwin

image.altText: A man and a woman in an outdoor environment.

props.synopsis: New Labor Leader Josh Willie says his party needs to "pause and reflect" on its historically bad election result and "do the hard work to earn Tasmanians' trust".

title.children: 'Differentiating ourselves from Liberals': New Labor leader Josh Willie outlines party vision

props.synopsis: Tassie's wildlife is already under increasing pressure, but are we unknowingly adding to their demise?  Have you bought a poison to get rid of rodents? The problem is it might not just be them you get rid of. Airlie Ward talks with reporter Bec Pridham.

title.children: TassieCast: Are we unwittingly killing our native wildlife with poison baits?

image.altText: An emperor penguin lies down in the snow, behind a small grey fluffy penguin chick.

props.synopsis: Scientists say there is emerging evidence of abrupt and potentially unstoppable changes in the Antarctic environment, heightening the risk of significant sea level rise and the extinction of species.

title.children: Scientists warn of 'abrupt changes' taking place in Antarctica

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government faces getting the Macquarie Point stadium approved this year, while the Liberals have also promised to set up TasInsure, bulk-billing GP clinics and strengthen laws allowing pets in rentals.

title.children: From stadium to TasInsure, Rockliff's agenda faces tests

image.altText: Josh Willie a man in his 40s with pale skin and dark hair. He is sitting in front of a radio microphone and wearing headphones.

props.synopsis: "There will be opportunities for us to collaborate and work with the crossbench," the new opposition leader tells ABC Radio Hobart Mornings.

title.children: 'No shortcuts to government', says new Labor leader Josh Willie

image.altText: Bird's eye view of rows of newly built houses with green lawns and solar panels on roofs.

props.synopsis: Amid a housing crisis and a quest to decarbonise, some Australians are asking how much space they really need to live well.

title.children: 'Space creep' and 'forever homes' are driving the housing crisis

image.altText: Canberra Raiders players celebrate after a game-winning try against Penrith.

props.synopsis: The top two places on the NRL ladder have all but been secured, after the Canberra Raiders and Melbourne Storm captured wins in a pair of classic contests on Friday night.

title.children: Raiders win with 95m golden point try, Storm hold on against Bulldogs

image.altText: An elated Port Adelaide AFL player grins and raises his arms in triumph after a win in the final game of his career.

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide produces a stunning finale, beating Gold Coast to send Ken Hinkley and Travis Boak out as winners, but the Suns are left hanging as Collingwood beats the Demons to keep top-four hopes alive. Follow live.

title.children: Port Adelaide send Hinkley, Boak off with fairytale win, Suns finals hopes left hanging

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ken Hinkley says he's so proud of his team after his final game
"It's been a dream come true": Travis Boak goes out a winner after 19 years
FT: Port Adelaide 10.11 (71) defeats Gold Coast 9.13 (67)

image.altText: Matt Wright

props.synopsis: Jurors in Matt Wright's trial have been played covert recordings in which the celebrity crocodile wrangler appears to blame an injured pilot for the death of his Netflix co-star.

title.children: 'I'm in strife from touching the machine': Matt Wright jury played phone taps

image.altText: man with glasses and curly blakc hair looks over his shoulder at something

props.synopsis: Erik Menendez has been denied parole, despite a reduced sentence that makes him eligible for release.

title.children: Erik Menendez denied parole after decades in prison

image.altText: Bob Harper looks on intensely as a Biggest Loser contestant struggles with an exercise in the gym.

props.synopsis: It's finally time to reflect on the horrifying cultural moment that was The Biggest Loser thanks to the new docuseries Fit for TV. Plus, read about four more shows to watch this month.

title.children: New documentary reveals what happened to The Biggest Loser contestants

image.altText: A white missile being fired into the sky above a bright orange burst of flame and a black military vehicle on the ground

props.synopsis: A secret North Korean missile base that likely houses six to nine nuclear-capable intercontinental ballistic missiles has been located close to the border with China, a new report says.

title.children: North Korea's 'undeclared' missile base poses potential nuclear threat, report says

image.altText: Douglas McCarthy looks stern and neutral while wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: West Australian GP Douglas William McCarthy, 63, is jailed for sexually abusing teenage girls as young as 14 and 15. WARNING: This article contains details some readers may find distressing.

title.children: 'Sorry and sordid tale': WA GP jailed for child sex offences

image.altText: cash and luxury items in boxes

props.synopsis: The postman is accused of supplying stolen bank cards to two separate organised crime groups, after allegedly stealing items from 70 letters or packages in Sydney's east.

title.children: Postal worker charged over alleged $1.4m fraud from stolen bank cards

image.altText: Storm clouds over Brisbane's Story Bridge from the city.

props.synopsis: A Queensland court on Thursday blocked the group from holding a march across Brisbane's Story Bridge due to safety concerns.

title.children: Brisbane pro-Palestinian march to take different route after court ruling

image.altText: An Adelaide Crows player jumps in the air with his knees and legs drawn up as he takes a mark.

props.synopsis: As AFL star Izak Rankine begins his four-game sanction for using a homophobic slur, LGBTQIA+ community groups and individuals say they are still dealing with fallout from the incident.

title.children: Izak Rankine 'not the victim' as Crows CEO considers more pride training

image.altText: A close-up shot of a shirtless man with long brown hair and a beard, with a weary look while appearing on a video call.

props.synopsis: A conspiracy theorist podcaster appears in court charged with murder over the death of a 30-year old woman in Perth's eastern suburbs.

title.children: Podcaster faces murder charge over death of 30yo Perth woman

image.altText: peter dutton in a crowd of people

props.synopsis: The former Liberal leader says Sussan Ley and the Nationals' David Littleproud are doing a "great job", and he would do what he could to ensure the party's best days lay ahead.

title.children: Peter Dutton rules out return to politics, says he's 'too old'

image.altText: A group of Giraffes line up on brown grass

props.synopsis: They’re one of Africa’s most recognisable animals — but it turns out we’ve been getting giraffes all wrong.

title.children: Giraffes aren't one species — but four

image.altText: A woman in a fur coat in a selfie-style shot.

props.synopsis: Patients say long wait times for elective surgeries at public hospitals and the high cost of private hospital care are why they're heading overseas.

title.children: 'Meat on the chopping block': What patients say about medical tourism in China

image.altText: Macdonald River where a car with three people inside crashed into the river

props.synopsis: A Hawkesbury woman has described hearing shouting after a car plunged into the Macdonald River in NSW, and how she struggled getting phone reception to call for help.

title.children: Locals called triple-0 after car plunged into river, but couldn't get through

image.altText: Ryan Cho wears sunglasses and a surgical mask as he walks down the street. A reporter holds a microphone towards him.

props.synopsis: A trainee surgeon accused of secretly filming hundreds of women in hospital toilets and bathrooms has "complex" mental health issues, his lawyer says.

title.children: Doctor accused of filming women in hospital bathrooms granted bail

image.altText: A black man in a white suit smiles in front of an orange background

props.synopsis: American rapper Lil Nas X has been arrested and taken to hospital for a suspected overdose after Los Angeles police say he charged at officers responding to a report of a naked man walking on a boulevard.

title.children: Lil Nas X arrested and taken to hospital in LA

image.altText: Pink silicone cooking utensils (including a whisky, spatula and slotted spoon) against a blue background.

props.synopsis: Here's what experts have to say about silicone utensils and cookware, including the products' safety, life span and how they differ from plastic.

title.children: How do silicone kitchen utensils differ from plastic — and are they safer?

image.altText: A young man lying in bed looks at his phone.

props.synopsis: Telehealth websites have exploded in popularity since the pandemic. But the federal government is worried of an "increasing risk" of putting profit over patient care. So what are the risks?

title.children: Are online telehealth sites legit? The government warns of an 'increasing risk'

image.altText: Millie Bobby Brown and Jake Bongiovi at an awards ceremony

props.synopsis: Millie Bobby Brown and Jake Bongiovi have adopted a baby girl. Here's how adoption works and why it's a "very involved" process in Australia, with a 98 per cent drop in adoption numbers since the 1970s.

title.children: Millie Bobby Brown and Jake Bongiovi welcome their first child via adoption

image.altText: US Department of State logo and US flag are seen in this illustration taken April 23, 2025.

props.synopsis: The US government appears to be expanding its visa crackdown, with a statement indicating authorities will review existing visas of more than 55 million people in search of violations.

title.children: People who already have US visas are still subject to 'continuous vetting'. What does that mean?

image.altText: A man in glasses and a shirt acts cheekily in front of the camera as he takes a seflie

props.synopsis: A teacher in regional Victoria has been charged with soliciting child abuse material, with his employer describing the alleged offending as "distressing" and "deeply concerning".

title.children: Victorian school teacher charged with soliciting child abuse material

image.altText: A yellow cane train, moving a rail line towards the camera

props.synopsis: Australia's second largest sugar processor is fined $100,000 nearly four years after the workplace accident.

title.children: Sugar processor fined after accident severs worker's fingers

image.altText: Sam Naismith pictured drinking a coffee at Whitten Oval, wears all black, another man behind wears black clothes and green cap.

props.synopsis: Fremantle ruck coach Sam Naismith and a fellow Dockers staffer are asked to leave the Whitten Oval after sitting in during a Western Bulldogs training session ahead of Sunday's meeting between the two teams.

title.children: Spying Freo coach kicked out of Dogs training session ahead of crunch clash

image.altText: Two Aboriginal men on a dark lit stage with orchestra behind them. Left man playing didigeridoo, right playing clapsticks

props.synopsis: A Yolŋu songman has collaborated with the Darwin Symphony Orchestra to create a musical experience combining ancient songlines with a classical ensemble.

title.children: Ancient songlines from Arnhem Land meet a classical symphony on Darwin stage
